note.p: Career: Apprenticed to a ship chandler; learned mathematics and Latin; served as a supercargo and made four long voyages (1795); was good at navigation, so commanded a vessel himself; Actuary to an insurance company (1804); published "A new American practical navigator"
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1838 No 35 pp 95-97
References: Alex D D Craik, 'James Ivory's last papers on the 'Figure of the Earth' (with biographical additions) in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 187-204
Notes: DSB gives death date as 16 Mar 1838.
